meanings.definition: (Latin) to cut off, cut away, prune; to curtail, diminish
meanings.english_definition: (Latin) to cut off, cut away, prune; to curtail, diminish

examples.notes: Example of 'resecare' used in the context of pruning trees.

verb_forms.present_indicative: reseco, resecas, resecat, resecamus, resecatis, resecant
verb_forms.imperfect_indicative: resecabam, resecabas, resecabat, resecabamus, resecabatis, resecabant
verb_forms.future_indicative: resecabo, resecabis, resecabit, resecabimus, resecabitis, resecabunt
verb_forms.perfect_indicative: resecavi, resecavisti, resecavit, resecavimus, resecavistis, resecaverunt
verb_forms.pluperfect_indicative: resecaveram, resecaveras, resecaverat, resecaveramus, resecaveratis, resecaverant
verb_forms.future_perfect_indicative: resecavero, resecaveris, resecaverit, resecaverimus, resecaveritis, resecaverint
verb_forms.present_subjunctive: resecem, resecas, resecet, resecemus, resecetis, resecant
verb_forms.imperfect_subjunctive: resecarem, resecares, resecaret, resecaremus, resecaretis, resecarent

inflection.notes: This is a Latin verb, so the inflection follows Latin verb conjugation rules.

usage_notes.explanation: 'Resecare' is a Latin verb meaning 'to cut off' or 'to prune'. It is used in contexts related to cutting, trimming, or reducing something. It can also be used figuratively to mean curtailing or diminishing something.

readability_explanation.text: This is a Latin word, so readability is dependent on familiarity with Latin.
